definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Human Josh lifts the link rig and rubs his temples.
sentences.chinese: 人形的Jake掀开顶盖，揉了揉自己的太阳穴。

sentences.english: You have only to push aside the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 你所要做的只是掀开那幕帘。

sentences.english: There are three big-scale education innovations in Song Dynasty respectively, namely Qingli Education Innovations, Xining Education Innovations and Chongning Education Innovations.
sentences.chinese: 范仲淹庆历兴学掀开了宋代三次大规模兴学的序幕。

sentences.english: Before she could refuse, he opened the blanket partway.
sentences.chinese: 她还未来得及拒绝，他已经掀开了毯子的一角。

sentences.english: Competition for head nurse position starts a new system for nursery.
sentences.chinese: 护士长竞争上岗，掀开了护理用人制度新的一页。

sentences.english: Now see Urmila Matondkar dancing to the tune of Mehbooba.
sentences.chinese: 现在看到科学家掀开舞蹈高达一个月。

sentences.english: By pondering over the past and turning on the new page, the coming philosophers are to be expected.
sentences.chinese: 反本开新，还有待于来哲掀开新的一页。

sentences.english: Para 2 My 17-year-old sister pushes back her covers and sits up.
sentences.chinese: 十七岁的姐姐掀开被子坐了起来。

sentences.english: I didn't pull the curtain aside, I didn't know the day or night.
sentences.chinese: 窗帘一天都没有掀开，不知道现在是白天还是黑天。

sentences.english: Between classes the Senior 1 English Office is a mad-house.
sentences.chinese: 课间高一英语备课组的办公室热闹得掀开了锅。

sentences.english: Uncovering the darkness sky there is a round moon that makes me blue.
sentences.chinese: 我掀开黑夜沉寂的幔帐，任一轮浑圆洒进我的窗口。

sentences.english: Steamer one opened, red yeast rice aroma first aroma.
sentences.chinese: 蒸笼一掀开，红曲香味先扑鼻。

sentences.english: On a table with a green cover lay a number of open books.
sentences.chinese: 一张铺著绿色台布的桌子上放著几本掀开的书。

sentences.english: So, I uncovered his feet and his feet were swollen badly and discolored.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我掀开了盖在他脚上的布。

sentences.english: But spectators could still lift the gauze to get a better look.
sentences.chinese: 但群众们依旧可以掀开薄纱一窥究竟。

definition: to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
to raise/to lift up (curtains, clothing etc)
to push aside/to part/to brush away
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
